wikipedia_page.main: Dame Patricia Anne Hodgson,  (born 19 January 1947) is a broadcasting executive, competition regulator, and academic administrator. She is a board member of the Centre for Data Ethics and Innovation having served as Chair of Ofcom from 2014 to 2017, having succeeded Dame Colette Bowe in April 2014,   She is also a trustee of the Policy Exchange and is Chair of the School Teachers' Review Body. From 2006 to 2012 she was Principal of Newnham College, Cambridge.

response: Dame Patricia Hodgson DBE was appointed as chairman of Ofcom for a three-year term from April 2014.  She was a member of the Ofcom board from July 2011 and became deputy chairman in January 2012. On 18 July 2016, it was announced that her term would be extended for a further year until 2018.
* Patricia Hodgson, Principal of Newnham College, Cambridge
*Patricia Hodgson, governor of the Wellcome Foundation and non-executive director of the Competition Commission
* Dame Patricia Hodgson – who resigned to take up a position on the board of media regulator Ofcom.
** Patricia Hodgson, broadcaster, educationalist and academic
